subject: World Cup (Skiing)
lead_paragraph: Maria Riesch of Germany won the women’s World Cup super-combined, defeating Marlies Schild of Austria by nine-hundredths of a second in the only World Cup event in Whistler, British Columbia, before the 2010 Olympics.Lindsey Vonn led the United States with a sixth-place finish, but her lead in the overall World Cup standing was trimmed to 54 points over Nicole Hosp of Austria, who finished fourth in the super-combined.Riesch, who had the fastest time in the super-giant slalom in the morning, took a careful approach in the slalom in the afternoon, finishing with a 2:10.07 total.
